Body:
Description: Noted that the application doesn’t have HSTS header implemented

Steps to Reproduce:
Verify the response headers of application for Strict Transport Security header.

11.5 AIC
Description Updated: Tracking of all reported Security concerns from HW
Next Steps Updated: R&D investigation on going

What We've Learned Updated: HTTP Strict Transport Security Headers (HSTS) are Included in the Published Reports site by default.
HSTS requires all HTTP requests to be forced over HTTPS this can be enabled for the AIC by editing the web.config by uncommenting the rewrite section.
For AIC version 11.5.0.137 this includes lines 270 through 296

See past support ticket #368629
Next Steps Updated: The AIC (11.6+) and Webserver (11.0+) adds the "Strict-Transport-Security" header to the response if the SSL is enabled.

Hi @Brandon West​,

 

@Nicholas Zimmer​ and I reviewed this ticket, and we wondered if you tagged this ticket for a new KB to be created or if an existing doc should be updated. Based on the second sentence in the Resolution Notes, it seems like the product pages for AIC and web reports should be updated.

 

Would you please clarify what kind of documentation you think is needed from this ticket?

 

CC: @Jake Mahon​
